channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Patch Now: Microsoft Scrambles to Fix Actively Exploited Windows Kernel Zero-Day
item.description:
Headline: Patch Now: Microsoft Scrambles to Fix Actively Exploited Windows Kernel Zero-Day

Summary:
Microsoft has released its November 2025 Patch Tuesday updates, addressing 63 vulnerabilities, including a critical zero-day in the Windows Kernel (CVE-2025-62215) that is being actively exploited in the wild. This privilege escalation flaw allows local attackers to gain full SYSTEM-level control of affected Windows and Windows Server systems. Due to its active exploitation, CISA has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating immediate patching for federal agencies. The update also fixes four other critical flaws, including a severe remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2025-60724) in the Microsoft Graphics Component.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft's November 2025 Patch Tuesday addresses a critical, actively exploited zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-62215) in the Windows Kernel. Learn about the risks and apply the patch now.

Article Slug: microsoft-patches-actively-exploited-windows-kernel-zero-day-cve-2025-62215

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: GAME OVER: 'Operation Endgame' Dismantles Global Cybercrime Services
item.description:
Headline: GAME OVER: 'Operation Endgame' Dismantles Global Cybercrime Services

Summary:
In a massive international crackdown dubbed 'Operation Endgame,' law enforcement agencies from 11 countries, coordinated by Europol, have dismantled the infrastructure of three major cybercrime-as-a-service platforms: the Rhadamanthys information stealer, the VenomRAT remote access trojan, and the Elysium botnet. The operation resulted in the seizure of over 1,025 servers, the takedown of 20 domains, and the arrest of the main suspect behind VenomRAT. The targeted malware was responsible for infecting hundreds of thousands of computers worldwide, stealing vast amounts of data, including millions in cryptocurrency.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Incident Response

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A major international law enforcement action, 'Operation Endgame,' has dismantled the cybercrime infrastructure of Rhadamanthys, VenomRAT, and the Elysium botnet, seizing over 1,000 servers.

Article Slug: operation-endgame-dismantles-rhadamanthys-venomrat-cybercrime-infrastructure

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK Overhauls Cyber Law, Targeting MSPs and Data Centers with New Bill
item.description:
Headline: UK Overhauls Cyber Law, Targeting MSPs and Data Centers with New Bill

Summary:
The United Kingdom has introduced the new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill, a major legislative update designed to strengthen the security of its critical national services. The bill significantly expands the scope of the 2018 NIS Regulations to include, for the first time, managed service providers (MSPs) and data centers. It also imposes stricter incident reporting timelines, requiring an initial notification within 24 hours of a harmful cyber event. The legislation aims to mitigate supply chain risks by allowing regulators to designate 'critical suppliers' who will be held to the same security standards as essential service operators.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The UK's new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill expands NIS regulations to MSPs and data centers, introduces 24-hour incident reporting, and strengthens supply chain security.

Article Slug: uk-introduces-cyber-security-and-resilience-bill-to-protect-critical-services

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: APT Caught Exploiting Cisco & Citrix Zero-Days in Sophisticated Attack
item.description:
Headline: APT Caught Exploiting Cisco & Citrix Zero-Days in Sophisticated Attack

Summary:
Amazon's threat intelligence team has discovered a sophisticated advanced persistent threat (APT) campaign that exploited two separate zero-day vulnerabilities in Cisco Identity Service Engine (CVE-2025-20337) and Citrix products (CVE-2025-5777) before they were publicly known. The attackers used the flaws to gain pre-authentication remote code execution and deployed custom, in-memory malware designed to evade detection. This discovery highlights a growing trend of targeting identity and access management systems at the network edge and underscores the capabilities of highly-resourced threat actors.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Amazon's threat intelligence team uncovered an APT exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities CVE-2025-20337 in Cisco ISE and CVE-2025-5777 in Citrix using custom in-memory malware.

Article Slug: amazon-uncovers-apt-exploiting-cisco-and-citrix-zero-day-flaws

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Synnovis Confirms Patient Data Stolen in Qilin Ransomware Attack on London Hospitals
item.description:
Headline: Synnovis Confirms Patient Data Stolen in Qilin Ransomware Attack on London Hospitals

Summary:
Pathology service provider Synnovis has officially confirmed that patient personal data, including names, NHS numbers, and dates of birth, was stolen during the June 2024 ransomware attack attributed to the Qilin gang. The attack caused widespread disruption to London hospitals, leading to the cancellation of over 1,100 procedures. After a lengthy forensic investigation, Synnovis acknowledged the data breach, which followed the attackers leaking approximately 400GB of data. Affected NHS trusts are now beginning the process of notifying individual patients whose information was compromised.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Synnovis confirms that patient personal information was stolen by the Qilin ransomware gang during a June 2024 cyberattack that caused major disruption to London hospitals.

Article Slug: synnovis-confirms-patient-data-stolen-in-qilin-ransomware-attack

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Retailers Unprepared for AI-Powered Cyberattack Tsunami, Report Warns
item.description:
Headline: Retailers Unprepared for AI-Powered Cyberattack Tsunami, Report Warns

Summary:
A new report from managed security provider LevelBlue reveals a troubling state of cybersecurity in the retail sector. The study found that 44% of retailers have experienced a significant increase in cyberattacks, with many feeling unprepared for the next wave of AI-powered threats. Despite 45% of executives expecting AI-driven attacks, only 25% believe their organization is ready to defend against them. The report also highlights major weaknesses in supply chain security, with nearly half of retailers admitting to having poor visibility into their suppliers' security practices, creating significant risk across the industry.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Phishing, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new report from LevelBlue finds the retail sector is experiencing a surge in AI-driven cyber threats but suffers from a critical preparedness gap, especially in supply chain security.

Article Slug: retail-sector-faces-surge-in-ai-driven-cyber-threats-report

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Dell Patches Critical 9.1 CVSS Flaw in Data Lakehouse Platform
item.description:
Headline: Dell Patches Critical 9.1 CVSS Flaw in Data Lakehouse Platform

Summary:
Dell has released a security update to address a critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-46608) in its Data Lakehouse platform, which received a CVSS score of 9.1. The flaw is an improper access control issue that could be exploited by a remote, high-privileged attacker to gain further elevated rights and potentially compromise the entire system. Due to the severity and the potential for a complete confidentiality, integrity, and availability loss, Dell is urging all customers to upgrade to version 1.6.0.0 immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Dell has patched a critical improper access control vulnerability (CVE-2025-46608) with a 9.1 CVSS score in its Data Lakehouse platform. Upgrade to version 1.6.0.0 is strongly recommended.

Article Slug: dell-patches-critical-privilege-escalation-vulnerability-in-data-lakehouse

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA KEV Alert: WatchGuard and Triofox Flaws Now Under Active Attack
item.description:
Headline: CISA KEV Alert: WatchGuard and Triofox Flaws Now Under Active Attack

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added three new vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, indicating they are under active attack. The additions include CVE-2025-9242, an out-of-bounds write flaw in WatchGuard Firebox appliances, and CVE-2025-12480, an improper access control vulnerability in Gladinet's Triofox product. The third is the recently disclosed Windows Kernel zero-day, CVE-2025-62215. Federal agencies are now mandated to patch these flaws by a specified deadline, and CISA strongly urges all organizations to prioritize remediation.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: CISA has added three actively exploited vulnerabilities to its KEV catalog: CVE-2025-9242 in WatchGuard Firebox, CVE-2025-12480 in Gladinet Triofox, and a Windows zero-day.

Article Slug: cisa-adds-actively-exploited-watchguard-and-triofox-flaws-to-kev-catalog

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Stealthy Phishing Attack Uses HTML Smuggling & Telegram Bots to Steal Credentials
item.description:
Headline: Stealthy Phishing Attack Uses HTML Smuggling & Telegram Bots to Steal Credentials

Summary:
A sophisticated phishing campaign is targeting organizations across Central and Eastern Europe, using HTML smuggling to deliver credential harvesting forms. Researchers at Cyble discovered the attack, which uses malicious HTML file attachments to bypass email security filters. Once a victim enters their credentials into the fake login page, an embedded JavaScript code exfiltrates the data directly to the attackers' private Telegram channels via the Telegram Bot API. This technique makes the campaign highly evasive, as it avoids the use of traditional, blockable C2 infrastructure.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers uncover a phishing campaign in Europe using HTML smuggling and the Telegram Bot API to steal credentials, bypassing traditional security and C2 infrastructure.

Article Slug: european-organizations-targeted-by-phishing-campaign-using-html-smuggling-and-telegram-bots

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: No Vacancy for Hackers: Hotels Hit by Booking.com Phishing & Ransomware
item.description:
Headline: No Vacancy for Hackers: Hotels Hit by Booking.com Phishing & Ransomware

Summary:
A large-scale phishing campaign is targeting the global hospitality industry by impersonating Booking.com. Attackers are using a phishing framework known as 'ClickFix' to socially engineer hotel staff into visiting malicious sites. The goal of the operation is to steal credentials for hotel booking platforms, which are then used to defraud guests or sold on criminal forums. In some cases, the attack chain also leads to the deployment of the PureRAT ransomware, adding data encryption and extortion to the threat.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Ransomware, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A phishing campaign impersonating Booking.com is targeting the hospitality industry, using the 'ClickFix' framework to steal credentials and deploy PureRAT ransomware.

Article Slug: hotels-targeted-in-booking-com-phishing-scheme-deploying-purerat-ransomware

Published Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Windows Kernel Zero-Day in November Patch Tuesday
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Windows Kernel Zero-Day in November Patch Tuesday

Summary:
Microsoft's November 2025 Patch Tuesday update addresses 63 vulnerabilities, including a critical Windows Kernel privilege escalation zero-day (CVE-2025-62215) that is being actively exploited in the wild. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 7.0, allows a local attacker to gain SYSTEM-level privileges. The release also includes patches for four other critical vulnerabilities, notably a remote code execution flaw in the Microsoft Graphics Component (GDI+) with a CVSS score of 9.8 (CVE-2025-60724). Other significant fixes address high-severity issues in Windows Kerberos, Microsoft Office, and Visual Studio, requiring immediate attention from administrators to prevent potential system compromise and supply chain attacks.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft's November 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes 63 vulnerabilities, including an actively exploited Windows Kernel zero-day (CVE-2025-62215) and a critical GDI+ RCE flaw (CVE-2025-60724). Learn about the risks and apply patches now.

Article Slug: microsoft-patches-actively-exploited-windows-kernel-zero-day-in-november-2025-patch-tuesday

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Advanced Threat Actor Exploits Cisco and Citrix Zero-Days in Targeted Attacks on Network Infrastructure
item.description:
Headline: Advanced Threat Actor Exploits Cisco and Citrix Zero-Days in Targeted Attacks on Network Infrastructure

Summary:
Amazon's threat intelligence team has discovered an advanced threat actor actively exploiting two previously undisclosed zero-day vulnerabilities in Cisco Identity Service Engine (ISE) and Citrix NetScaler Application Delivery Controllers (ADC). The vulnerabilities, now tracked as CVE-2025-20337 (Cisco) and CVE-2025-5777 (Citrix), are being used to target critical identity and network access control infrastructure. The attackers are leveraging custom malware to gain initial access and establish persistence on these edge devices. Both Cisco and Citrix have been notified and are working on patches, which security teams are urged to apply immediately upon release.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: An advanced threat actor is actively exploiting two new zero-day vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-20337 in Cisco ISE and CVE-2025-5777 in Citrix NetScaler, to compromise network access control systems.

Article Slug: advanced-threat-actor-exploits-cisco-ise-and-citrix-netscaler-zero-days

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK Introduces Sweeping Cyber Security and Resilience Bill to Regulate MSPs and Mandate Stricter Breach Reporting
item.description:
Headline: UK Introduces Sweeping Cyber Security and Resilience Bill to Regulate MSPs and Mandate Stricter Breach Reporting

Summary:
The UK government has introduced the Cyber Security and Resilience Bill to Parliament, a landmark piece of legislation set to replace the 2018 NIS Regulations. This new bill significantly expands the regulatory landscape by bringing Managed Service Providers (MSPs) into scope for the first time, a move impacting up to 1,100 firms. It also imposes stricter incident reporting rules, requiring an initial report within 24 hours and a full report within 72 hours. The legislation aims to bolster national security by strengthening supply chain resilience and aligning the UK with updated international standards like the EU's NIS2 Directive.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The UK government has introduced the Cyber Security and Resilience Bill, a new law to replace the NIS Regulations, bringing MSPs into scope and enforcing stricter 24-hour incident reporting rules.

Article Slug: uk-introduces-sweeping-cyber-security-and-resilience-bill

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Asahi Breweries Crippled by Ransomware Attack, Shipments Plummet to 10% Ahead of Peak Holiday Season
item.description:
Headline: Asahi Breweries Crippled by Ransomware Attack, Shipments Plummet to 10% Ahead of Peak Holiday Season

Summary:
Japan's largest brewer, Asahi Group Holdings Ltd., is facing severe operational paralysis more than a month after a devastating ransomware attack. The attack disabled the company's core order and shipment management system, forcing a regression to manual processes like phone calls and faxes. As a result, shipments are at only 10% of normal levels, a critical blow as the company enters its busiest sales month. The incident, which has also forced Asahi to postpone its Q3 earnings report, highlights the extreme vulnerability of complex supply chains and legacy IT systems to modern cyber threats.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Japan's Asahi Breweries is suffering a massive operational disruption from a ransomware attack, with shipments down 90% and its supply chain paralyzed ahead of the peak holiday season.

Article Slug: ransomware-attack-cripples-asahi-breweries-operations-ahead-of-peak-season

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Clop Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Dartmouth College, Threatens to Leak Data
item.description:
Headline: Clop Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Dartmouth College, Threatens to Leak Data

Summary:
The notorious Clop ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Dartmouth College, an Ivy League university in the U.S. On November 11, 2025, the group added the institution to its dark web leak site, threatening to publish exfiltrated data if the university does not enter negotiations. This incident highlights the increasing trend of ransomware attacks targeting the education sector, which holds vast amounts of sensitive personal data. Dartmouth College has not yet issued a public statement on the alleged breach, but the threat from Clop is considered highly credible due to the group's track record.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The notorious Clop ransomware gang has listed Dartmouth College as its latest victim, threatening to publish stolen data in a double-extortion attack targeting the education sector.

Article Slug: clop-ransomware-gang-claims-attack-on-dartmouth-college

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Massive Phishing Campaign Abuses Facebook's Own Email Domain to Bypass Security Filters
item.description:
Headline: Massive Phishing Campaign Abuses Facebook's Own Email Domain to Bypass Security Filters

Summary:
Security researchers at Check Point have uncovered a large-scale phishing campaign that cleverly abuses Meta's own infrastructure to deliver highly convincing malicious emails. By using the legitimate 'Business invitation feature' in Facebook Business Suite, attackers are sending phishing emails from the authentic `facebookmail.com` domain, allowing them to bypass standard email security filters. The campaign has already targeted over 5,000 businesses, primarily SMBs, with over 40,000 emails. The attack aims to trick employees who are accustomed to receiving genuine Meta notifications into giving up their credentials or other sensitive information.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A massive phishing campaign is abusing Facebook's legitimate email domain and Business Suite to send convincing malicious notifications to thousands of businesses, bypassing traditional security.

Article Slug: facebook-business-suite-abused-in-large-scale-phishing-campaign

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: ICS Patch Tuesday: Siemens, Schneider Electric Address Critical Flaws in Industrial Control Systems
item.description:
Headline: ICS Patch Tuesday: Siemens, Schneider Electric Address Critical Flaws in Industrial Control Systems

Summary:
The November 2025 Industrial Control Systems (ICS) Patch Tuesday includes a series of important security advisories from major operational technology (OT) vendors, including Siemens, Schneider Electric, Aveva, and Rockwell Automation. The patches address numerous vulnerabilities in products used across critical infrastructure sectors like manufacturing and energy. Notably, a critical flaw in Aveva software also affects Schneider Electric products, highlighting supply chain complexities in the OT space. The coordinated disclosure aims to improve security posture and mitigate risks of remote code execution and denial-of-service attacks in sensitive industrial environments.

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The November 2025 ICS Patch Tuesday features critical security updates from Siemens, Schneider Electric, and others to address vulnerabilities in industrial control systems.

Article Slug: ics-patch-tuesday-siemens-schneider-electric-address-critical-flaws-november-2025

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Google Sues Operators of 'Lighthouse' Phishing-as-a-Service Platform Used in Massive Smishing Campaigns
item.description:
Headline: Google Sues Operators of 'Lighthouse' Phishing-as-a-Service Platform Used in Massive Smishing Campaigns

Summary:
Google has filed a civil lawsuit in New York against the alleged China-based operators of 'Lighthouse,' a large-scale Phishing-as-a-Service (PhaaS) platform. The platform enabled cybercriminals to launch SMS phishing (smishing) campaigns that have targeted over one million users in 120 countries. The service provided toolkits for impersonating trusted brands like E-ZPass and the USPS to harvest financial information. The threat group, dubbed 'Smishing Triad,' used over 194,000 malicious domains. Google's legal action aims to dismantle the platform's infrastructure, marking another instance of a major tech company using lawsuits to combat cybercrime.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Google has filed a lawsuit against the operators of the 'Lighthouse' Phishing-as-a-Service (PhaaS) platform, a criminal enterprise enabling smishing attacks at a global scale.

Article Slug: google-sues-operators-of-lighthouse-phishing-as-a-service-platform

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Iranian APT 'Ferocious Kitten' Continues to Target Dissidents With Custom MarkiRAT Surveillance Malware
item.description:
Headline: Iranian APT 'Ferocious Kitten' Continues to Target Dissidents With Custom MarkiRAT Surveillance Malware

Summary:
The Iranian-aligned APT group 'Ferocious Kitten' continues its long-running cyber-espionage campaign against Iranian dissidents and activists, according to new research from Picus Security. Active since at least 2015, the group uses spear-phishing emails with malicious Office documents to deploy its custom remote access trojan (RAT), MarkiRAT. This malware is a sophisticated surveillance tool, featuring an advanced keylogger that activates only when password managers are not in use, clipboard hijacking, and data exfiltration over HTTP/S. The group also employs various defense evasion techniques, including the use of BITS and the RTLO trick to disguise malicious files.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Iranian APT group Ferocious Kitten is using a custom RAT called MarkiRAT in an ongoing cyber-espionage campaign targeting dissidents, employing advanced surveillance and evasion tactics.

Article Slug: iranian-apt-ferocious-kitten-targets-dissidents-with-markirat-malware

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: NYDFS Part 500 Final Rules on MFA and Asset Inventory Now in Effect for Financial Firms
item.description:
Headline: NYDFS Part 500 Final Rules on MFA and Asset Inventory Now in Effect for Financial Firms

Summary:
As of November 1, 2025, the final provisions of the amended New York Department of Financial Services (NYDFS) Part 500 cybersecurity regulation are now in force. Financial entities regulated by NYDFS must now comply with stricter requirements for implementing multi-factor authentication (MFA) across their information systems and maintaining a comprehensive, detailed asset inventory. These rules, part of a major update from 2023, conclude a two-year transition period. Firms must certify their compliance for the first time in their annual reports due by April 15, 2026, and are also guided to enforce similar MFA standards on their third-party vendors.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The final provisions of the NYDFS Part 500 cybersecurity regulation are now in effect, mandating multi-factor authentication (MFA) and comprehensive asset inventory for all regulated financial firms.

Article Slug: nydfs-part-500-cybersecurity-rules-on-mfa-and-asset-inventory-take-effect

Published Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →
